graphtools

Interface Graph

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdjacencyGraph, LabeledGraph, MatrixGraph

    public interface Graph
    A simple undirected graph. The user of the interface can add and remove vertices and edges at will. Basic information about the graph can also be queried.

    Vertices in graphs (like Java arrays) are zero based.

    The Graph interface is only for simple undirected graphs. A simple graph refers to one in which there is at most one edge incident to a pair of vertices. An undirected graph implies that if there is an edge from one vertex to another, then there is also an edge from the second vertex back to the first. Alternatively, each edge is bi-directional.

    The Graph interface provides four methods for manipulating vertices. Note that these operations may execute in time proportional to the square of the number of vertices for some implementations (the MatrixGraph class, for example).

    The Graph interface provides three methods for accessing and manipulating edges. Currently the Graph interface specifies that every graph is undirected and simple: edges are bi-directional and appear at most once between a pair of vertices. Note that the execution time of these operations is dependent on the underlying data model.

    The Graph interface provides two methods for accessing information about the neighbors of a vertex.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEdge(int u, int v)
      Adds an edge incident to the specified vertices.
      void addVertex()
      Adds a new vertex to this graph.
      void addVertices(int count)
      Adds several vertices to this graph.
      Graph clone()
      Returns a deep copy of this Graph instance.
      int degreeOfVertex(int v)
      Returns the degree of the specified vertex.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getNeighbors(int v)
      Returns a sorted List of all vertices adjacent to the specified vertex.
      boolean hasEdge(int u, int v)
      Returns true if this graph has an edge incident to the given vertices.

      Returns the number of edges in this graph.
      int numberOfVertices()

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        Graph clone()
        Returns a deep copy of this Graph instance.
        Returns:
        a clone of this Graph instance

      • numberOfVertices

        int numberOfVertices()
        Returns the number of vertices in this graph.
        Returns:
        the number of vertices in this graph

      • numberOfEdges

        int numberOfEdges()
        Returns the number of edges in this graph.
        Returns:
        the number of edges in this graph

      • addVertex

        void addVertex()
        Adds a new vertex to this graph. The new vertex will have the smallest id possible, which will be the number of vertices in the graph.

      • addVertices

        void addVertices(int count)
        Adds several vertices to this graph. The new vertices will have the smallest id's possible, which will start at the number of vertices of the graph and range to this value minus one.
        Parameters:
        count - number of vertices to add

      • removeVertex

        void removeVertex(int v)
        Removes a specified vertex from this graph. All edges incident to this vertex will also be removed.
        Parameters:
        v - id of the vertex to remove

      • removeVertices

        void removeVertices(int[] vertices)
        Removes a list of vertices from this graph. All edges incident to any removed vertex will also be removed.
        Parameters:
        vertices - array of vertex id's to remove

      • hasEdge

        boolean hasEdge(int u,
                int v)
        Returns true if this graph has an edge incident to the given vertices.
        Parameters:
        u - first vertex id
        v - second vertex id
        Returns:
        true if there is an edge incident to u and v

      • addEdge

        void addEdge(int u,
             int v)
        Adds an edge incident to the specified vertices. If such an edge already exists, no changes will occur.
        Parameters:
        u - first vertex id
        v - second vertex id

      • removeEdge

        void removeEdge(int u,
                int v)
        Removes an edge (if any) incident to the specified vertices. If no such edge exists, no changes will occur.
        Parameters:
        u - first vertex id
        v - second vertex id

      • degreeOfVertex

        int degreeOfVertex(int v)
        Returns the degree of the specified vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - vertex id
        Returns:
        degree of the specified vertex

      • getNeighbors

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getNeighbors(int v)
        Returns a sorted List of all vertices adjacent to the specified vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - vertex id
        Returns:
        a sorted list of adjacent vertices
